overview_of_class: This course focuses on interconnections between new ideas in literature, culture and politics in the early 20th century. Texts include great Modernist novels Peterburg (1913) by Andrei Bely, Master and Margarita (1940) by Mikhail Bulgakov, and Evgeny Zamiatin's We (1921); poetry by Aleksandr Blok, Vladimir Mayakovsky, and Osip Mandelstam. These major works are discussed in the broad Russian and European cultural and historical context.
name: 20th-Century Russian Literature
title: WCAS SLAVIC 211-1-20 20th-Century Russian Literature

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course focuses on interconnections between new ideas in literature, culture and politics in the early 20th century. Texts include great Modernist novels Peterburg (1913) by Andrei Bely, Master and Margarita (1940) by Mikhail Bulgakov, and Evgeny Zamiatin's We (1921); poetry by Aleksandr Blok, Vladimir Mayakovsky, and Osip Mandelstam. These major works are discussed in the broad Russian and European cultural and historical context.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: The course will be conducted by a combination of lecture and discussion, and I expect students to be ready to answer questions in class. This means that it is imperative to read the assigned material before each lecture on it.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
There will be an in-class midterm exam (25%), final exam (25%), 3 in-class quizzes (30%), contributions to discussion, class attendance (20%).

PLEASE NOTE: all requirements are subject to modification by the instructor. Any changes will be announced in advance.
